memberdef.argsstring: (const std::string &dynamicsFile, std::vector< unsigned > &nb_shapes_allagents, std::vector< unsigned > &shapeIDagent, std::vector< int > &edges, std::vector< double > &radius_allshapes, std::vector< double > &masses, std::vector< double > &mois, std::vector< double2 > &delta_gtos)
memberdef.name: initialiseSetting

briefdescription.para: The function creates all agents from the data stored by InputStatic.cpp. It also creates the kinematics and dynamics of the agents by calling updateSetting().

parameterdescription.para: The input file containing the current state and driving forces for all agents
The number of shapes by agent (size: number of agents)
A correspondence between the shape ids (index) and the agent (value) (size: number of shapes)
The indices of the first shape for each agent (size: number of agents + 1)
The radii of all shapes (size: number of shapes)
The moment of inertia of the agents
The relative positions of the shapes with respect to the center of mass of each agent

simplesect.para: EXIT_SUCCESS if no issue with the Dynamics file EXIT_FAILURE otherwise (the return code comes from updateSetting())

briefdescription.para: The function updates all agents with the agentDynamics (dynamic data) XML files. It initiates the list of neighbours by calling determine_agents_neighbours().

parameterdescription.para: The input file containing the current state and driving forces for all agents

simplesect.para: EXIT_SUCCESS if no issue with the Dynamics file EXIT_FAILURE otherwise

briefdescription.para: Updates the list of neighbors for each agent in the crowd.

detaileddescription.para: This function creates the lists based on the proximity of each agent to other agents and to walls. We will consider all agents within a certain distance from one another, ie the maximum distance that can be traveled by an agent within dt seconds at max speed vMaxAgent. We multiply it by 2 in the "extreme" case of two pedestrians walking (running) fast towards each other. All this ensures that all agents who can potentially collide within dt are taken into account.

This function is responsible for updating the state of each agent in the Crowd. It performs the following steps:
Handles mechanically active agents using the mechanical layer.
Handles non-mechanically active agents (simple positional update)
Generates an output file with the new position and velocity, plus their angular counterparts.

parameterdescription.para: The input dynamics file will be overwritten with the output of the mechanical layer.

inbodydescription.para: The dynamics follow a simple relaxation equation, ie dv/dt = (v_des - v) / tau_mech ==> v(t)= v_des (1 - e^-t/tau_mech) + v(t=0) e^-t/tau_mech

briefdescription.para: Checks if the given agent is mechanically active in the crowd. An agent is considered mechanically active if it is present in the mech_active_agents container.

simplesect.para: True if the agent is mechanically active, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Checks if there will be any future collisions between agents in the crowd.

simplesect.para: true if there will be future collisions, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: The function generates the final state of the agents by overwriting the input dynamics file.
